      • faceNum

        public int faceNum
        Current number of faces.

      • vl

        public UVertexList[] vl
        Array of vertex lists that are stored in this UGeometry object. This is only intended as a convenient way to collect vertex lists, for instance to perform collective transformations on them. The vertex lists may be drawn to screen using drawVertexLists().

      • child

        public java.util.ArrayList<UGeometry> child

      • vert

        public UVertexList vert
        Vertex list containing all vertices used in this object. Manipulating vertices directly will change the geometry.

      • quadStrip

        public UGeometry quadStrip(UVertexList v1,
                  UVertexList v2,
                  boolean reverse)
        Adds QUAD_STRIP of faces built from two vertex lists.
        Parameters:
        v1 - First edge of QUAD_STRIP
        v2 - Second edge of QUAD_STRIP
        reverse - Build in reverse order?

      • quadStrip

        public UGeometry quadStrip(UVertexList[] vl)
        Adds a mesh of QUAD_STRIPs built from an array of vertex lists. Each vertex list is treated as a single edge and will be connected to the next edge in the array. All vertex lists must have the same number of vertices.
        Parameters:
        vl - Array of vertex lists to be used as edges.

      • quadStrip

        public UGeometry quadStrip(UVertexList[] vl,
                  boolean close)

      • quadStrip

        public UGeometry quadStrip(UVertexList[] vl,
                  int vln)
        Adds a mesh of QUAD_STRIPs built from an array of vertex lists. Each vertex list is treated as a single edge and will be connected to the next edge in the array. All vertex lists must have the same number of vertices.
        Parameters:
        vl - Array of vertex lists to be used as edges.
        vln - Number of lists to use from array

      • triangleFan

        public UGeometry triangleFan(UVertexList vl,
                    boolean useCentroid,
                    boolean reverseOrder)
        Adds a TRIANGLE_FAN constructed from input vertex list. If useCentroid==true then a centroid is calculated and used as the center point for the fan, if not the first vertex in the vertex list is used.
        Parameters:
        vl - Array of vertex pairs
        useCentroid - Build from calculated centroid?
        reverseOrder - Build in reverse order?
        Returns:

      • sweepXZ

        public UGeometry sweepXZ(UVertexList prof,
                UVertexList path)
        Sweep a 2D profile along a 2D path to make a 3D sweeped object. Assumes a UVertexList path in the XZ plane and a profile in the XY plane.
        Parameters:
        prof -
        path -
        Returns:

      • beginShape

        public UGeometry beginShape(int _type)
        Starts building a new series of faces, using the same logic as PApplet.beginShape(). Currently supports the following types: TRIANGLE_FAN, TRIANGLE_STRIP, TRIANGLES, QUADS, QUAD_STRIP While shape is being built vertices are stored in a temporary array, and only the ones that are used are copied to the vert vertexlist.
        Parameters:
        _type - Shape type (TRIANGLE_FAN, TRIANGLE_STRIP, TRIANGLES, QUADS, QUAD_STRIP)

        public UGeometry endShape()

      • addFace

        public int addFace(UVec3[] vv)
        Adds single face or quad. If vv.length==3 a UFace will be added, otherwise a UQuad will be added.
        Parameters:
        vv - Array of 3 or 4 vertices, depending on whether face is a triangle or quad.
        Returns:

      • addVertexList

        public UGeometry addVertexList(UVertexList vv)
        Adds a UVertexList object to the vl array. The object is stored by reference, so any changes made to it through this class will also affect the original instance. Not to be confused with vertex(UVertexList vl)
        Parameters:
        vv -
        Returns:

      • extrudeNonFlat

        public static UGeometry extrudeNonFlat(UVertexList vl1,
                       UVertexList vl2,
                       float z,

      • extrude

        public static UGeometry extrude(UVertexList vl,
                float z,
                boolean reverse)
        Produces a UGeometry mesh by extruding a QUAD_STRIP along its face normal. The input is a list of vertices making up the QUAD_STRIP. The face normal of the first quad is used to calculate the extrusion, multiplied by the parameter z. All vertices are presumed to be co-planar.
        Parameters:
        vl - Vertex list defining a QUAD_STRIP mesh
        z - Offset to extrude by along the face normal, can be positive or negative
        reverse - Construct in reverse order? Useful in case face normals of resulting mesh is incorrect.
        Returns:

      • drawVertexLists

        public void drawVertexLists(processing.core.PApplet p)
        Convenience method to call UVertexList.drawVertices() on all vertex lists. NOTE: begin/endShape() are not called.
        Parameters:
        p - Reference to PApplet instance

      • add

        public void add(UStrip s)

      • removeDuplicateVertices

        public UGeometry removeDuplicateVertices()

      • matchIDtoVertex

        public UVec3[] matchIDtoVertex(int[] id,
                      UVec3[] v)
        Takes array of vertex indices and returns the matching UVec3 instances from the vert vertex list. If the parameter v is not null it is filled with pointers to the matching instances, if not a new UVec3 array of id.length length.
        Parameters:
        id - Array of vertex IDs to match
        v - Array to populate with instances, if null a new UVec3 array is created.
        Returns:
        Array of UVec3 instances matching vertex IDs
